*The thesis in (4) is in an interesting way weaker than those in (1), (2), and (3): They rule out
abortion even in cases in which both mother andchild will die if the abortion is not performed.
By contrast, one who held the view expressed in (4) could consistently say that one needn’t pre-
fer letting two persons die to killing one.
**Cf. the following passage from Pius XII, Address to the Italian Catholic Society of Midwives: “
